title-group.article-title: Kite Measurements in the Boundary Layer

abstract.p: Kites have a number of applications as probes into the Earth's boundary layer, and have been in research use since the 18th Century. The performance of kite anemometers is discussed, based on tests of a selection of single line kites. Two designs are identified as suitable for anemometry and calibrations to assess their accuracy are presented. Other kite applications, as aerial platforms and for energy extraction, are also reviewed.
